docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Welcome to the Tagify documentation! Tagify is an AI powered file organizer that helps you organize your files in a more efficient way. This documentation will help you get started with Tagify and understand how to use it.

Warning

This documentation is a work in progress.

Info

Tagify is licensed under the GNU General Public License v3.0. You can find the source code on GitHub.

The Tagify UI

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
To install Tagify, download the latest installer from the releases page.

Then, go through the wizard like you would with any other software.

docs.title: Goals
docs.text:
• Organize files in a more efficient way
  • Make it easier to find files
  • Save time by automating the organization process

docs.title: Inspiration
docs.text:
Tagify has heavily been inspired by the following projects, but they didn't really fit my needs. I needed something QUICK. Something that could run for some time, then automatically tag all my files.

  • TagStudio
  • Google Photos
  • PhotoPrism

docs.title: Supporters
docs.text:

docs.title: Step 1.
docs.text:
To add a file, open the File menu and click on Add File.

After that, a dialog will appear asking you to use AI to tag the file.

docs.title: Step 2.
docs.text:
After clicking Ok, a file selector will be opened. Select the file you want to add and click Open.

The AI will tag it if it has a supported file extension and if you enabled AI tagging. If not, you will have to tag it manually.

docs.title: Creating tags
docs.text:
Tags are the way Tagify organizes your files. They are used to categorize files and make them easier to find.

Info

AI cannot currently generate tags. This will be added in a future release.

Open the Edit menu.

Click on Manage Tags.

Type in the tag name in the text box then click the plus button.

Warning

You can't delete tags yet. This will be added in a future release.

docs.title: Opening a library
docs.text:
After installing and running Tagify, you will need to open a library to start organizing your files.

Open the File menu on the menubar, and click on Open Library.

Select a directory for the library to live in.

Info

A .Tagify directory will be created in the selected directory.

After that, the library will be opened and you will be able to start adding files to it.

docs.title: Step 1: Install Python
docs.text: Download and install Python from the official website: https://www.python.org/downloads/

docs.title: Step 2: Install G4F
docs.text:
Open a CMD window and run the following command:

pip install g4f fastapi uvicorn

docs.title: Step 3: Run G4F
docs.text:
Run the following command in the CMD window:

g4f api

docs.title: Step 4. Connect the app to G4F
docs.text:
In Tagify, open the Edit menu and click on API Key Manager

In the dialog, on the dropdown menu: select G4F.

The API key doesn't matter, you can put anything you want.
